headline.main: DEFENDANT ADMITS ALIAS AT SPY TRIAL; Former Ford Berlin Executive Used It in Sending Nazi Concern Plane Information

lead_paragraph: Edmund Carl Heine, former $30,000-a-year executive of the Ford Motor Company in Germany, passed an uncomfortable three hours on the witness stand yesterday at the Brooklyn espionage trial as the government sought to break down his testimony that he had gathered and forwarded to Germany information about the United States aviation industry purely for commercial purposes.
abstract: Heine admits using alias in sending mil aviation data to German Peoples Car Co; calls world fortunate that Ford refused to make warplanes for belligerents
